meanings.definition: Treat (a liquid) with heat to kill or slow the growth of bacteria
meanings.sent1: The chef pasteurises the milk before using it in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pasteurise milk to make it safe for consumption.
meanings.sent3: The milk was feeling chilly, so it asked to be pasteurised to warm up.
meanings.sent4: The heat pasteurises the milk, turning it into a shield against harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent5: The bubbling pot pasteurises the milk, making it pure and clean.

meanings.sent1: The factory pasteurises large batches of juice every day.
meanings.sent2: Farmers pasteurise the milk before sending it to the market.
meanings.sent3: The juice was feeling adventurous, so it decided to get pasteurised for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: The pasteurisation process pasteurises the liquid, ensuring it is safe to drink.
meanings.sent5: The machine pasteurises the juice, transforming it into a healthy beverage.
